Authors: Panghurian F.P., Surantha N., Zahra A.
Title: A low-power scenario for IOT-based indoor air quality monitoring system at workplace
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Panghurian, F.P., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Surantha, N., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Zahra, A., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presents the development air quality monitoring system for indoor workplace that send measurement CO, CO2, PM2.5, temperature and humidity and send it via IEEE 802.11 b/g wireless communication. The problem is many sensor node for indoor air quality should not always send data to server in normal situation. It could spend power consumption and the data would send it periodically. Although the data send periodically, the sensor must handle emergency situation like fire. The results show that with controlled transmission interval not only spend power consumption but the device also good respond in emergency situation and user could monitor air quality remotely via web application. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: CO; CO2; indoor air quality monitoring; internet-of-things; PM2.5
